gurmukhi: pRB Dwm AbY clIXY hmry ieh BwNq khXo kubjw hir soN ]Aiq hI muK dyKkY rIJ rhI su khXo niRp ky ibnqI fr soN ]
transliteration: Prabh Dhaam Abai Chaleeyai Hamre Eh Bhaant Kahyo Koubjaa Har(i) Son|| At(i) Himoukh Dekh-kai Reejh Su Kahyo Nrip Ke Nintidar Son||
translation: Kubja asked the Lord to go with her to her home, she was fascinated on seeing the face of Krishna, but she was also afraid of the king;

gurmukhi: hir jwnXo ik mo mY rhI bs hÍY ieh BwNiq khXo iqh so Cr soN ]kirhO qumro su mnorQ pUrn kMs ko kY bD hau br soN ]831]
transliteration: Prabh Dhaam Abai Chaleeyai Hamre Eh Bhaant Kahyo Koubjaa Har(i) Son|| At(i) Himoukh Dekh-kai Reejh Rahisu Kahyo Nrip Ke Bintidar Son||831||
translation: Krishna thought that she was allured on seeing him, but keeping her in illusion, the Lord (Krishan) said, “After killing Kansa, I shall fulfil your desire.”831.

gurmukhi: kubjw ko suvwr kY kwj qbY pur dyKn ky rs mY AnurwgXo ]pwie gXo iqh Taur ibKY Dn suMdr koN soaU dyKn lwgXo ]
transliteration: Koubjaa Ko Suvaar Kai Kaaj Tabai Pur Dekhan Ke Ras Mai Annuraagyo|| Dhaae Gado Tih Thaur Bikhai Dhan Soundar Kon Sooo Dekhan Laagyo||
translation: After finishing the task of Kubja, Krishna was absorbed in seeing the city; the place where the women were standing, he went there to see them;

gurmukhi: BiR`qn qy kr qy su mnY hir kY mn mY AqhI kuip jwgXo ]gwVI ksIs keI Dn ko diRV kY ijh qy niRp ko Dn jwgXo ]832]
transliteration: Bhrittan Te Kar Te Su Manai Har(i) Kai Man Mai At-hikoup(i) Jaagyo|| Gaddikaidhan Ko Drid Kai Jih Te Nrip Ko Dhan Jaagyo||832||
translation: The spies of the king forbade Krishna, but he was filled with rage; he pulled his bow with force and with its twang, the women of the king awoke with fear.832.

gurmukhi: gwVI ksIs deI kuip kY rup TwF BXo iqh Taur ibKy ]br isMG mno diRg kwF kY TwFo hY pyKY joaU igrY BUm ibKy ]
transliteration: Gaddikasees Daikoup(i) Kai Roup Dhaadh Bhayo Tih Thaur Bikhe|| Bar Singh Mano Drig Kaadh Kai Thaadho Hai Pekhai Jooo Girai Bhoom Bikhe||
translation: Getting enraged, Krishna created fear and stood on the same place; he was standing like a lion gaping wide his eyes in wrath; whosoever saw him, fell on the ground;

gurmukhi: dyKq hI frpXo mGvw frpXo bHmw joaU lyK ilKy ]Dn ky tukry sMg jo Dn mwrq sXwm khY Aiq hI su iqKy ]833]
transliteration: Dekhat Hidarpyo Maghvaa Darpyo Brahmaa Jooo Lekh Likhe|| Dhan Ke Toukre San Jo Dhan Maarat Syaam Kahai At(i) Hisu Tikhe||833||
translation: Seeing this scene even Brahma and Indra were filled with fear; breaking his bow, Krishna began to kill with its sharp bits.833.

gurmukhi: DnK qyj mY brinXoN ikSn kQw ky kwj ]Aiq hI cUk mo qy BeI iCmIXY so mhwrwj ]834]
transliteration: Dhanakh Tej Mai Barniyon Kishan Kathaa Ke Kaaj|| At(i) Hichook Mo Te Bhaichhimeeyai So Mahaaraaj||834||
translation: For the sake of the story of Krishna, I have mentioned the strength of the bow; O Lord ! I have greatly and extremely erred, forgive me for this.834.

gurmukhi: Dn ko tukrw kir lY hirjI brbIrn ko soaU mwrn lwgXo ]Dwie pry niRp bIr qbY iqn ky mn mY Aq hI kuip jwgXo ]
transliteration: Dhan Ko Toukraa Kar(i) Lai Har(i)jibarbderan Ko Sooo Maaran Laagyo|| Dhaae Dare Nrip Beer Tabai Tin Ke Man Mai At Tikoup(i) Jaagyo||
translation: Taking the bit of the bow in his hand Krishna began to kill there the great heroes; there those heroes also fell upon Krishna in great rage;
